answer is B

choices.B: Dynamic routing is supported for any IPSec mode in NSX.
choices.C: IPSec VPNs use the DPDK accelerated performance library.
choices.A: VPNs can be configured on the command line interface on the NSX manager.
choices.D: IPSec VPN services can be configured at Tier-0 and Tier-1 gateways.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
Saw in the ICM 4.0 :

When you deploy IPSec VPN, you should consider several factors: 
•IPSec VPN services are available on both Tier-1 and Tier-0 gateways.
• Protected networks must be segments created through the NSX UI or policy APIs.
• Segments can be connected to either Tier-0 or Tier-1 gateways to use VPN services.
• Tenants with overlapping networks require NAT on Tier-0 gateways. 
• VPN-based dynamic routing for VTI is supported on Tier-0 gateways only. 
• NSX supports site-to-site IPSec VPNs in tunnel mode. 
• IPSec tunnels use the DPDK-accelerated performance.
CD is correct

It's not correct B.
Policy-based IPSec mode not be supported dynamic routing protocols.

> B. Dynamic routing is supported for any IPSec mode in NSX.

Selected Answer: CD
When using dynamic routing protocols, route-based IPSec mode must be used.
 Therefore, not all IPSec modes.
https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.0/administration/GUID-7D9F7199-E51B-478B-A8BC-58AD5BBAA0F6.html

Selected Answer: BD
B: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-7D9F7199-E51B-478B-A8BC-58AD5BBAA0F6.html
D: https://docs.vmware.com/en/VMware-NSX/4.1/administration/GUID-7D9F7199-E51B-478B-A8BC-58AD5BBAA0F6.html

Selected Answer: CD
C. IPSec VPNs use the DPDK accelerated performance library.
D. IPSec VPN services can be configured at Tier-0 and Tier-1 gateways.

questions.question_text: Which two statements are true for IPSec VPN? (Choose two.)

choices.A: Inter-Tier interface on the Tier-0 gateway
choices.C: Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR
choices.E: Downlink Interface for the Tier-1 DR

discussion.content: In Single tier, there is no Tier-1, so B & C are correct; The answer given is wrong.

For sure:
B. Tier-0 Uplink interface 
C. Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR

Selected Answer: BC
If there is no T1 gateway the right answer should be B and C. A mentions of an intra-tier, but this one is present only when there is a T0 and a T1 gateway connected to each other and the question mentions single tier topology. D. Tier-1 SR Router Port mentions of a T1 but again this is a single tier configuration. 

D and E would be another good answer if the traffic is East-West/lateral between VMs connected to two different Overlay Segments.

Selected Answer: BC
B. Tier-0 Uplink interface
C. Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR

Selected Answer: BC
B. Tier-0 Uplink interface
C. Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR

B. Tier-0 Uplink interface
C. Downlink Interface for the Tier-0 DR
